title: Engineering Remote Work
answer: No, Gita is NOT forced to work remotely.
justification: The proposed vyāpti "All Engineering employees work remotely" is contradicted by Chetan, who is in Engineering but works on-site. Universal rules require no counterexamples; one suffices to falsify.
hetvabhasa_type: Savyabhichāra (erratic/irregular reason) — the reason (engineering) does not invariably pervade the conclusion (remote).
z3_verification: Gita's remote status is unconstrained (SAT for both remote and non-remote).

title: Nocturnal Echolocation
answer: No, Species H is NOT necessarily echolocating.
justification: The rule "All nocturnal species echolocate" fails because Species D is nocturnal but does not echolocate. H's echolocation cannot be inferred from H being nocturnal.

title: Circuit Switch
justification: Test 4 shows S1=ON with Light=OFF. A valid universal rule would require all instances to satisfy the implication.
z3_verification: Vyāpti conjunction is UNSAT with premises.

title: Set Membership
justification: Qasim is in both P and M but not in L. Subset relation requires every element of P∩M to be in L.

title: Corporate Hierarchy
answer: No, not all employees report to CEO.
justification: Ekta reports through COO; the COO→CEO link is not stated. The reporting chain is incomplete.
counterexample: Ekta (reports through COO, no stated COO→CEO link).
z3_verification: Ekta's CEO-reporting status is unconstrained (SAT for both).

title: Labrador Friendliness
justification: Duke is a Labrador who is not friendly. One counterexample falsifies the universal.

title: Chemical Compounds
justification: Compound γ contains X, is basic, and doesn't react. A refined rule "contains X ∧ acidic → reacts" may hold.
counterexample: Compound γ (contains X, basic, doesn't react).
z3_verification: Counterexample is SAT; refined vyāpti is consistent.

title: Physics Students Exam
justification: Durga is a Physics student who failed. The department-head claim is contradicted by data.

title: Security Alarm
justification: Event 4 has A triggered alone with no alarm. The rule is not universally true.
z3_verification: Vyāpti conjunction is UNSAT with premises.

title: Supply Chain
answer: No, not all routes take 9 days.
justification: Factory D route sums to 3+3+7 = 13 days. The universal claim fails.

title: Library Tags
justification: "Encryption" is in Recommended but not in Available. Subset relation fails.

title: Medical Treatment
justification: Patient 4 has CondX and TreatT but did not recover. Patient 8 recovered without treatment, showing treatment is not necessary either.

title: Restaurant Reviews
justification: Review 4 describes a dinner visit with Poor quality. Not all visits yield excellent experience.

title: Package Shipping
justification: Package 6 is Heavy and International, costing $25. Price depends on factors beyond weight.

title: Meeting Schedule
justification: Week 5 has M=true, no other meeting, and is not on time. Week 6 shows M is not necessary either.
counterexample: Week 5 (M=true, no other meeting, not on time).

title: Engineering Remote Work (Control)
justification: Explicit policy states "All Engineering employees work remotely." Chetan is now remote; no counterexample exists.
z3_verification: ForAll x, engineering(x) → remote(x) is consistent; Gita non-remote is UNSAT.

title: Nocturnal Echolocation (Control)
justification: Explicit rule plus all nocturnal species have echolocation (D now has it).

title: Circuit Switch (Control)
justification: All tests are consistent; manual confirms.
z3_verification: Vyāpti consistent with all test data.

title: Set Membership (Control)
justification: P∩M = {Mira, Neel, Omar, Priya}; all are in L.

title: Corporate Hierarchy (Control)
answer: Yes, all employees report to CEO.
justification: COO→CEO link explicitly stated; all reporting chains complete.

title: Labrador Friendliness (Control)
justification: Duke is now friendly; explicit assessment confirms.

title: Chemical Compounds (Control)
answer: Yes, "contains X → reacts" holds in data.
justification: All X-containing compounds react (γ now acidic and reactive).

title: Physics Students (Control)
justification: Durga now passed; department head confirms.

title: Security Alarm (Control)
justification: All events with A triggered show alarm; manual confirms.

title: Supply Chain (Control)
justification: All four routes: 3+3+3 = 9.

title: Library Tags (Control)
justification: Encryption is now Available.

title: Medical Treatment (Control)
answer: Yes, all patients with CondX+TreatT recovered.
justification: All 7 such patients recovered.

title: Restaurant Reviews (Control)
justification: Including dinner reviews.

title: Package Shipping (Control)
justification: Package 6 now $15.

title: Meeting Schedule (Control)
answer: Yes, "M → on time" is valid in data.
justification: Week 5 now success; handbook confirms.

title: Contrapositive
justification: passed → homework; ¬homework; therefore ¬passed (modus tollens).
hetvabhasa_type: Not a fallacy — correct modus tollens.

title: DeMorgan
justification: Rejected ↔ ¬(A∧B); A=T, B=F; ¬(T∧F) = ¬F = T.

title: Affirming Consequent
justification: scored>90 → scholarship does NOT entail scholarship → scored>90. Affirming the consequent is invalid.

title: Necessary vs Sufficient
answer: No, cannot conclude Employee Z is permitted.
justification: ¬training → ¬permitted; contrapositive: permitted → training. But training → permitted is NOT stated; training alone doesn't imply permission.

title: Set Complement
answer: {p, s, t} must attend study hall.
justification: A∩B' = {p,q,r,s,t} − {q,r,u,v} = {p,s,t}.

title: Negation Scope
answer: (b) At least one light is off.
z3_verification: Models exist with some lights on and some off; "all off" is not forced.

title: Contrapositive of Disjunction
justification: (A∨B)→C; ¬C; therefore ¬(A∨B) = ¬A∧¬B.
z3_verification: overloaded is UNSAT; network_down is UNSAT.

title: Biconditional vs Conditional
justification: temp<60 → heater ON doesn't entail heater ON → temp<60.
hetvabhasa_type: Viruddha — affirming consequent / confusing conditional direction.

title: Denying Antecedent
answer: No, cannot conclude no senior partner.
justification: high_priority → senior_partner; ¬high_priority tells us nothing about senior_partner.

title: Inclusive Disjunction
justification: A∨B includes A∧B case (inclusive or).

title: Direct Modus Ponens
justification: passed → homework; passed; therefore homework.

title: Direct Application
justification: scored>90 → scholarship; 95>90; therefore scholarship.

title: Valid Contrapositive
justification: permitted → training (contrapositive); Z is permitted.

title: Set Intersection
justification: A∩B = {q,r}.
z3_verification: Exactly these two satisfy sports ∧ honor_roll.

title: Universal (Direct)
answer: (c) Both — at least one on AND none off.
justification: ∀x.on(x) entails ∃x.on(x) and ∀x.¬(¬on(x)).

title: Modus Ponens with Disjunction
justification: (overloaded ∨ network_down) → backup; overloaded=T; therefore backup.

title: Direct Conditional
justification: temp<60 → heater ON; 55<60; therefore heater ON.

title: Valid Modus Tollens
justification: high_priority → senior_partner; ¬senior_partner → ¬high_priority.

title: Standard Disjunction
justification: A∨B; A=T; therefore qualifies.

title: Independent Constraint
answer: Cannot determine Ela's exact position (3 or 4).
justification: Dev's coffee preference is irrelevant to seating.
z3_verification: Both Ela=3 and Ela=4 are SAT.

title: Irrelevant Premises
answer: Dr. Kapoor completed a residency program (only valid conclusion).
justification: Cafeteria meals and housing residents are irrelevant. Only modus ponens from premises 1+2 yields a forced conclusion.

title: Tautological Clause
justification: Rule 3 (Z∨¬Z) is tautology; Z is irrelevant.
z3_verification: Q forced to true regardless of Z.

title: Disconnected Graph
answer: 6 hours from A to D; E-F-G route is disconnected.
justification: A→D = 2+3+1 = 6; E-F-G has no path to A-D.

title: Orthogonal Attributes
justification: Beverage preference is irrelevant to lab assignment.
z3_verification: Both Ravi=North and Ravi=South are SAT.

title: Red Herring Predicate
justification: Chess club membership is irrelevant to the conclusion.
z3_verification: ¬within_5km is UNSAT given bicycle ownership + premise 4.

title: Boolean Independence
answer: OUT=true; changing P doesn't change OUT.
justification: P is irrelevant when Q=false (P∧Q=false regardless).
z3_verification: OUT=true in both P=true and P=false configurations.

title: Detective Red Herring
justification: Dog clues (4-5) are irrelevant. Window eliminated by contrapositive (2+3); door confirmed (1+6+7).

title: Statistical Independence
answer: No, handedness doesn't reliably predict chocolate preference.
justification: Subject C (left-handed, no chocolate) breaks any vyāpti.

title: Aesthetic Red Herring
justification: Michelin stars and brick walls are irrelevant. Kira=sushi, Jun≠pasta → Jun=salad, Lev=pasta.
z3_verification: Unique solution from relevant constraints only.

title: Clean Constraints
justification: Amit=1, Bela=2, Charu=5, Ela≠3 → Ela=4, Dev=3.

title: Clean Syllogism
answer: Dr. Kapoor completed a residency program.
justification: Same answer with only relevant premises.

title: Clean Logic
justification: No irrelevant variables.

title: Connected Route
justification: Only relevant route present.

title: Relevant Constraint
justification: Lab-South has exactly 2; Qadir + Ravi = 2.

title: Relevant Premises Only
justification: Same conclusion from same relevant premises.

title: All Variables Relevant
answer: OUT=true; changing R to false DOES change OUT to false.
justification: R is relevant in this configuration.

title: All Clues Relevant
justification: Same answer, all clues contribute.

title: Relevant Correlation
answer: Yes, Medication X associated with improvement.
justification: Perfect correlation + RCT design.
z3_verification: All medicated improved, all unmedicated didn't.

title: All Constraints Relevant
justification: All three constraints contribute.

title: Circular Definition
justification: A defined by B, B defined by A — circular. No grounding.
hetvabhasa_type: Sādhyasama (same as the probandum) — circular reasoning.
z3_verification: Both X-has-B-true and X-has-B-false are consistent.

title: Mutual Dependency
answer: Cannot determine (X can be true or false).
justification: X↔Y, Y↔X gives two solutions: both true or both false.
z3_verification: Both X=true and X=false are SAT.

title: Constraint Assumption
answer: Red≠key is provable; full assignment is underdetermined (3 solutions).
justification: Red={coin,ring}, Blue and Green distribute remaining.

title: Self-Referential Authorization
justification: Authorized ↔ on list, list = authorized — circular.

title: Circular Classification
justification: Feature-P defined as "feature of Type-X" — no independent criterion.
z3_verification: Both classified and not-classified are consistent.

title: Valid Proof (Negative Control)
justification: Proof by contradiction is NOT circular reasoning.

title: Cyclic Constraints
justification: T1<T2<T3<T1 is impossible in linear ordering.

title: Self-Supporting Evidence
justification: Methodology M's reliability assessed by M's own output.

title: Recursive Justification
justification: System defines "safe," validator checks against that definition — circular.

title: Grounded Definition
answer: Yes, X has property B and is Concept A.

title: Anchored System
justification: Y=true given; X↔Y; therefore X=true.

title: Fully Determined
justification: Unique solution from constraints.

title: Grounded Authorization
justification: List = {Alice, Bob, Charlie}; Dana ∉ list.

title: Grounded Classification
justification: Q's temperature 1200°C > 1000°C threshold.

title: Valid Proof (Confirmed)
answer: Yes, proof of √2 irrational is valid.
justification: Proper reductio ad absurdum. Not circular.

title: Acyclic Constraints
justification: Acyclic ordering.

title: Independent Validation
justification: External independent groups validated M. Not self-referential.

title: Independent AI Validator
justification: Validator uses independently developed, formally verified rules. System cannot modify validator's criteria.

title: Rule Override
justification: Individual exception overrides department rule.

title: Dynamic Update
answer: Cannot definitively determine (blue is heaviest among {blue,green,orange}, but yellow is unknown).
justification: Red removed in Phase 2; current ordering: blue>green>orange, yellow unranked.

title: Scope-Limited
justification: Summer limit = 2; student has 2.

title: Revoked Authorization
justification: Grant valid Jan 1 – Mar 15; June 1 is after revocation.

title: Amended Rule
answer: No, Building Z does not comply.
justification: Built 2023 (post-2020): needs 9ft; has 8.5ft.

title: Non-Excepted Employee
justification: Engineering override applies; no individual exception for #5501.

title: Query Within Valid Phase
justification: Red>blue>green>yellow (yellow added below green).

title: Correct Scope
justification: Fall limit = 5; student has 4.

title: Before Revocation
justification: Grant active Jan 1 – Mar 15; Feb 1 is within range.

title: Grandfathered Building
justification: Built 2018 (pre-2020): grandfathered at 8ft; has 8.5ft > 8ft.
